PARAGRAPH.STRING: is an extinct volcano located in the Waikato region of New Zealand's North Island.
is the highest peak in the Waikato region.
was active in the late Pliocene and early Pleistocene times.
is 22 kilometres to the west of Te Awamutu and eight kilometres from the small settlement of Pirongia, and
is clearly visible from the Tasman Sea, being just 25 kilometres from the coast at Aotea Harbour.

Mt Pirongia forest park is a popular place for hunters from Hamilton seeking a quick day trip hunt, holding several feral goat herds on its bush clad slopes, rumours abound about small numbers of red deer released by farmers after an earlier deer farming boom went bust. This forest park is administered by the Waikato DOC office in Hamilton.
